accessibility.contrast_check: Ensure all text on blue backgrounds is white. Ensure text on yellow accents is dark slate.

instructions_to_main_agent: Use the 'Outfit' font for all headings to give a friendly, modern school vibe.
The 'Hero' section should feel airy and safe. Use the school bus image subtly or as a masked element.

For the 'Product Screens Preview', build a CSS-only 'Phone Frame' component (rounded-3xl, border-8, border-slate-900) and place a 'Dashboard' UI mock inside it using HTML/CSS. Do not look for a screenshot image.
Use the 'Bento Grid' layout for the Features section. Mix large cards (2x2) with small cards (1x1).
The 'Trust' section is critical. Use a clean row of logos (use text placeholders if real logos aren't available like 'City High', 'Valley School', etc.) with low opacity.
Ensure the 'Contact Form' is friendly. Use floating labels or clear placeholders.
Do NOT use dark mode. This is a strict Light Mode design.
Use the provided Logo URL in the Navbar and Footer.
UNIVERSAL_GUIDELINES_FOR_MAIN_AGENT: You tend to converge toward generic, 'on distribution' outputs. Avoid this.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy.
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur) for sticky headers.
Every interaction needs micro-animations - hover states, transitions.
Use 2-3x more spacing than feels comfortable. Cramped designs look cheap.
